name: Trivial Stuff 3 Quiz / Test | Mixed 10 Questions | 10 Questions

questions.text: Woody Allen directed Sylvester Stallone in which film?
questions.explanation:
Bananas.

	Stallone had a small part as a thug who harasses Allen on a subway train in this 1971 classic comedy.

questions.text: What was the first paved coast-to-coast highway in the United States?
questions.explanation:
The Lincoln Highway.

	The Lincoln Highway opened in 1913 and ran from New York to California.

questions.text: What mammal has the shortest gestational period?
questions.explanation:
opossum.

	An opossum bears its young after 12 to 13 days of conception.  The Asian Elephant has the longest gestational period which is 20 months.

questions.text: Even though Al Capone's nickname was "Scarface", he didn't actually have a scar on his face.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Al "Scarface" Capone actually got the scar on his face during a bar fight in Brooklyn.  Capone had claimed to have gotten the scar from fighting in World War I.  Capone never served in World War I.

questions.text: What was the first zoo in the United States?
questions.explanation:
Philadelphia Zoological Gardens.

	The Philadelphia Zoological Gardens open in 1874. It was also the first zoo to have a children's zoo which opened in 1938.

questions.text: What was Greta Garbo's last film?
questions.explanation:
Two-Faced Woman.

	Greta Garbo retired from show business in 1941 at the age of 36.

questions.text: Is Leopold Stokowski credited with suggesting the title of Disney's "Fantasia"?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	After conductor Stokowski was selected to provide the musical accompaniment for the feature film, he suggested the name "Fantasia" to describe the style of music.

questions.text: When did New York City stop having a "Miss Subway"?
questions.explanation:
1976.

	The program ran from May, 1941 to December 1976.  Every month a woman over 17 would be chosen to be Miss Subway.  She was featured on signs and given $50 and a sterling silver charm dangling with subway tokens.

questions.text: Who first sang "Santa Claus is Coming to Town" on the radio?
questions.explanation:
Eddie Cantor.

	Eddie Cantor sang it on his radio show one week before Thanksgiving in 1934.  It was written in 1932 by Haven Gillespie and J. Fred Coots.

questions.text: In the TV show "The Man From U.N.C.L.E.", what does UNCLE stand for?
questions.correct: United Network Command for Law and Enforcement
options: United Nations Command for Law and Equality
United Nations Command of Law and Enforcement
United Network Chain of Law and Enforcement
questions.explanation:
United Network Command for Law and Enforcement.

	The TV series starred Robert Vaughn and David McCallum and was on the air from 1964 to 1967.
